g.text: UMA wide ecosystem - Alice to Bob (push data)
RqP Client is registered at Alice's AuthN server as a confidential client and is pre-registered at Bob's AuthZ server as a universal public client
Claims Provider publishes its metadata on a URL https:
Claims Provider is registered at Alice's AuthN server and is assigned 'query-users' admin role
Alice's email_address is in access_token returned at step 3. a)
The email_address is determined by RqP Client
Claims Provider is assigned the 'query-users' admin role, thus can query any user to get their claims
Use Alices's email_address extracted from access_token from a request at step 5. a)
Use Alice's email_address extracted from a request body at step 5. b)
In addition to claims_token, pushed claims may also contain metadata such as:
2. file_info (filename, file size, file digest, mime type)
AuthZ Server uses domain part of Alice's email_address extracted from claims_token
to load Claims Provider configuration from URL:
1. domain part of email_address vs. claims issuer
[RqP Client uses Authorization Code Grant - Alice is involved]
[RqP Client uses Client Credential Grant - Alice is not involved]
[Get Claims - Alice was involved at step 3. a)]
[Get Claims - Alice was not involved at step 3. b)]
[Prepare email_address - Alice was involved at step 3. a)]
[Prepare email_address - Alice was not involved at step 3. b)]
